reviews.review_msg: Dont recommend
Terrible communication throughout the course. Didn't learn anything from the class. The prof is unhelpful and unkind.
Participation is mandatory and Dr Kil doesn't teach but instead has everyone do group worksheets.
The Prof doesn't teach and your grade relies on group projects.

Grade is dependent on group project with a system that is set up very poorly. Unclear communication. Difficult to communicate with. Lectures did not teach much- all learning was self-taught. We were expected to do a lot of readings with unclear ideas of what was important to know

Course completely depends on the groups that you're put in—even then you're teaching yourself. Prof is completely disconnected and unreachable, with her list of "email guidelines" to follow. Grandfather died suddenly and had to miss class, emailed to let prof know and was met with no response, most likely due to me not following her email rules.

The course completely relies on the quality of the groups you're put into. Prof is completely disconnected and hardly responds to emails—even when they follow the "email guidelines." Grandfather died so emailed prof to advise I wouldn't be in class and received no response—likely due to my potential failure in adhering to the "email rules."
A large part of your grade relies on group projects. If you get a bad group, Dr Kil doesn't help.

I wish I took 250 with a different prof. Take this class with her if you just want credits, but if you're interested in the content wait until it's being instructed by someone else. Very uninvolved, the "lecture" component is nonexistent, but tests were online and open-book. Don't take if you don't like group work, that's most of the course.

The course itself is easy, as most of the grades were self evals, peer evals and completion marks. The professor seemed lazy and uninvolved in her own class, we had NO LECTURES, just the textbooks and weekly "mandatory" (they dont check) synchronous breakout rooms. Got stuck with a TERRIBLE group for the term project and prof showed no empathy

This is an online course with no lectures. Everything you learn is from the textbook & then applied in a weekly group discussion assignment. You're graded on a big group project, participation quizzes & 4 online open-book exams. These things are easy if you read the textbook but that does make the grading scale competitive.
Grading scale makes no sense. The difference between an A and B is 1%.
Very unresponsive professor. Save yourself the headache and don't take.
Final grades dont make sense. Grade cut offs are much higher than outlined in the syllabus

Very disorganized, with minimal engagement in lectures and a lack of responsiveness to emails. The majority of the material must be self-taught, and their demeanor often comes across as unnecessarily harsh. If you're seeking a course that challenges not only your academic skills but also your ability to find joy, this might be the one.
Tests have extremely short time limits without a buffer for technical issues.
Dr. Kil doesn't teach. The class is mostly self taught with a bunch of group projects. Super stressful for no reason.
Dr. Kil did not teach anything. The course was pretty much self taught. Assignment instructions would contradict themselves, making assistants unnecessarily hard.
Dr. Kil did no teaching through the whole semester. You're paying to teach yourself everything.
Warning: very bad do not take

Hali's lectures did not contribute to my learning. She seems very knowledgable about her field, but its not translated well into teaching. The group project is to rewrite the whole textbook & was unclear and overall disorganized. She says 2-3 business days to reply to emails but really means a week or never. Straightforward class but insufferable.

This lady is power hungry. Like stated by other rater, she treats students like highschoolers who know nothing & she knows everything. She should bring a throne to class to sit on with that attitude. I barely studied and got a B but she was insufferable. Dont bother attending lectures-they are useless. Group project was stressful w unclear rubric.

Doing well on the chapter rewrite group project really depends on your group members. So hard to balance everyone fairly contributing their portion but also maintaining the quality of the final product. It was bad, especially when its almost due and everyone has a diff idea of what "rewriting" meant. Instructions not clear, my grade went down 10%

If you don't like group work then this isn't the class for you. However, I worked with a wonderful group of students so I didn't find group work to be a problem at all. 90% of the test material is from the textbook. I felt that the lectures were not very helpful. I recommend to study a lot. Class averages on tests were around 60%

Lack of teaching skills, misunderstanding of what respect means. Her tests/lectures are poorly made, and she demands respect without giving any. Treats students like high schoolers and refuses to respond when not addressed with her title. Hali should consider some lecture workshops, and some temperament courses.

Not only does she not respond to emails and is unapproachable, she doesn't teach. Going to her lectures is a waste of time and energy.

Do not take this class with her.

Try and avoid taking this class with her, she is not very approachable and any questions you have she won't respond back being helpful at all and expect you to find all the answers on her syllabus. Expect a lot of readings (2 chapters per week) and the lectures just consist of textbook content. Also, don't expect her to respond to emails!!!

Content is a balance between easy and difficult. Expect a LOT of weekly reading. Don't bother with emails unless you're okay with waiting 72+ hours for a response. She does not record her lectures which was very inconvenient, but her lectures were basically a prelude to the textbook anyway. Only saving grace for my grade were her study guides.

We submitted a paper worth 30 percent of our grade on March 28, we had our final  (worth %30) on April 20 and today is April 27. We have not heard any thing back yet, which means that the new semester is gonna start in a week and we still do not know how we did on our paper that we submitted on March 28. Unbelievable!!!!!!

Just DO NOT TAKE ANY COURSES WITH HER. You NEVER can reach your prof or TAs. Although the materials are not hard, they are a lot. She usually covers 2 chapters in each class, which is a lot, around 90 pages of textbook each week. Most importantly, you do not get your grades back. wait until the final to see how you did in that class.
